channel.title: Windows XP
channel.description:
I have Windows 7 at the moment, picture:
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/dtaRDI.jpg[/img]
However, I know that Windows XP runs a lot of things without so much CPU, at least from what I know I think. And it doesn't run a lot of processes, so should I downgrade to Windows XP knowing that it isn't supported anymore?

item.title: Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:31, topic:437585”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=540290.msg3959020#msg3959020 date=1333074167]

Most newer computers don’t support windows xp anymore and often get blue screened, should make sure your computer can support it before making the downgrade.

What? I need a legitimate source before I will believe this.
[/quote]
The what?

The only thing I could think of is the cache bonus on win7.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:28, topic:437585”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=540290.msg3958425#msg3958425 date=1333002592]
Most newer computers don’t support windows xp anymore and often get blue screened, should make sure your computer can support it before making the downgrade.
[/quote]

What? I need a legitimate source before I will believe this.[/quote]

The only thing I could think of is the cache bonus on win7.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Dj_:

Win7 requires 2gb of ram just to run.

I have 512MB of DDR RAM and it runs just fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @Djayboi6 Dj_
item.description:
@Djayboi6 wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:21, topic:437585”][quote author=Dj_ link=topic=540290.msg3956529#msg3956529 date=1332803673]
Win7 requires 2gb of ram just to run.
[/quote]

False.

@OP

Keep win7, if I were you do a fresh install of win7 and optimize it to fit your needs.[/quote]
well maybe its not 2gb to run but when i tried installing it on my old computer it was a requirement to install it.

Read full topic

item.description:

Most newer computers don’t support windows xp anymore and often get blue screened, should make sure your computer can support it before making the downgrade.

item.title: Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:25, topic:437585”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=540290.msg3957623#msg3957623 date=1332914047]
Honestly, XP is wonderful.
With my specs (1.5GB ram, 2.2GHz AMD processor) almost everything runs great. Runescape won’t run with remotely decent graphics, and various games like Minecraft won’t run (not sure why that is the only limitation I’ve found so far).
My dad has a Windows 7 desktop with 8GB of ram and a 4GHz processor (not sure what type) and his computer runs slower than mine. Downgrading to XP is wonderful for stability, although it may not be as graphically appealing (which is modifiable).
[/quote]
4ghz at how many cores?[/quote]
4 or 6, I can’t remember.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:

With my specs (1.5GB ram, 2.2GHz AMD processor) almost everything runs great. Runescape won’t run with remotely decent graphics, and various games like Minecraft won’t run (not sure why that is the only limitation I’ve found so far).
My dad has a Windows 7 desktop with 8GB of ram and a 4GHz processor (not sure what type) and his computer runs slower than mine. Downgrading to XP is wonderful for stability, although it may not be as graphically appealing (which is modifiable).[/quote]

item.title: Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

desktop os, at least in the circles i’ve been in, has always referred to a general-use OS for the desktop platform.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

t4, in my defense, he said ‘Desktop OS’. I was assuming that was the DE.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:9, topic:437585”][quote author=t4 link=topic=540290.msg3957043#msg3957043 date=1332866323]
windows distributions pre-windows 7 are horrible at memory management. if you wish to minimize your cpu/memory footprint in 7, simply turn off aero and its effects.
[/quote]

Turning off Aero has little to no effect. Comparing it to runescape: When I had XP I didn’t lag. When I got 7 2 years ago(?) Runescape became really laggy. Disabled all Aero/ended all unneeded processes and it still lagged like crazy. Even got a new gfx card and upgraded to 2 gigs of RAM.

My computer was very responsive when I first got Windows 7 but that was just from the clean install.[/quote]
do you have a whole bunch of unnecessary services? i find 7 to be far faster than XP.

[quote=“Daginith, post:15, topic:437585”][quote author=tL link=topic=540290.msg3957596#msg3957596 date=1332911169]
Linux is a shit desktop OS.

Stick with Windows 7, XP is pretty turd.
[/quote]
depends what dm/de you have installed. KDE is almost exactly the same as windows.[/quote]
i love linux like the next guy, but i will admit there are some serious issues with it. i sort of find it funny how you thought thug-life was referring to the desktop environment.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Dj_:

Win7 requires 2gb of ram just to run.

False.

@OP

Keep win7, if I were you do a fresh install of win7 and optimize it to fit your needs.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:19, topic:437585”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=540290.msg3957639#msg3957639 date=1332914755]

Honestly, XP is wonderful.
With my specs (1.5GB ram, 2.2GHz AMD processor) almost everything runs great. Runescape won’t run with remotely decent graphics, and various games like Minecraft won’t run (not sure why that is the only limitation I’ve found so far).
My dad has a Windows 7 desktop with 8GB of ram and a 4GHz processor (not sure what type) and his computer runs slower than mine. Downgrading to XP is wonderful for stability, although it may not be as graphically appealing (which is modifiable).

Both those games run on java. might have something to do with that…

Runescape runs relatively fine on minimal graphics settings, but Minecraft will not run at all. I’d imagine it would have to do with my processor (which, as I check it randomly, jumps between 900mHz and 2.2GHz) or my low amount of ram (which I recently upgraded by stealing .5GB from my sister’s desktop). Other games like Terraria get laggy with high resolution, so it may be my graphics card.
[/quote]
Bad ram + Bad Processor + Bad video card?
I think that might be it…

and the Processor keeps jumping? I dont think thats good…might have something to do with windows though. on Linux it stays almost steady. [/quote]
It’s very random, if I reopen the system information window a few times it ends up showing each of those values.
And, you’re right that all of them are bad – Yet XP still runs everything basic well, and most games pretty well. I love it.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:18, topic:437585”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=540290.msg3957628#msg3957628 date=1332914195]

Honestly, XP is wonderful.
With my specs (1.5GB ram, 2.2GHz AMD processor) almost everything runs great. Runescape won’t run with remotely decent graphics, and various games like Minecraft won’t run (not sure why that is the only limitation I’ve found so far).
My dad has a Windows 7 desktop with 8GB of ram and a 4GHz processor (not sure what type) and his computer runs slower than mine. Downgrading to XP is wonderful for stability, although it may not be as graphically appealing (which is modifiable).

Both those games run on java. might have something to do with that…
[/quote]
Runescape runs relatively fine on minimal graphics settings, but Minecraft will not run at all. I’d imagine it would have to do with my processor (which, as I check it randomly, jumps between 900mHz and 2.2GHz) or my low amount of ram (which I recently upgraded by stealing .5GB from my sister’s desktop). Other games like Terraria get laggy with high resolution, so it may be my graphics card.[/quote]
Bad ram + Bad Processor + Bad video card?
I think that might be it…

and the Processor keeps jumping? I dont think thats good…might have something to do with windows though. on Linux it stays almost steady.

Read full topic

With my specs (1.5GB ram, 2.2GHz AMD processor) almost everything runs great. Runescape won’t run with remotely decent graphics, and various games like Minecraft won’t run (not sure why that is the only limitation I’ve found so far).

Both those games run on java. might have something to do with that…[/quote]
Runescape runs relatively fine on minimal graphics settings, but Minecraft will not run at all. I’d imagine it would have to do with my processor (which, as I check it randomly, jumps between 900mHz and 2.2GHz) or my low amount of ram (which I recently upgraded by stealing .5GB from my sister’s desktop). Other games like Terraria get laggy with high resolution, so it may be my graphics card.

item.title: Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Windows XP is wonderful. I’ve been a user for years now, I’ve never been disappointed. I’ve also had desktops with vista and windows 7 – Windows 7 is usable (and laggy), and vista is obviously just terrible.

XP is the way to go.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

t4:

windows distributions pre-windows 7 are horrible at memory management. if you wish to minimize your cpu/memory footprint in 7, simply turn off aero and its effects.

Turning off Aero has little to no effect. Comparing it to runescape: When I had XP I didn’t lag. When I got 7 2 years ago(?) Runescape became really laggy. Disabled all Aero/ended all unneeded processes and it still lagged like crazy. Even got a new gfx card and upgraded to 2 gigs of RAM.

My computer was very responsive when I first got Windows 7 but that was just from the clean install.

Read full topic
